comment.author: 74784995@N00
comment._content: Some of the signed names check * with the crew of aircraft 44-50493 of the 578BS which was damaged but survived a Berlin mission 18 March 1945 18 Mar 1945 578th Sqdn. A/C 493 P Vickers, R.E. 2nd Lt. * CP Schwarzer, D.E. 2nd Lt. N Roberts, K.E. 2nd Lt. * B Henthorn, W.N. S/Sgt. R Costanzo, N.T. S/Sgt. E Krutys, E.V. T/Sgt. RW Nock, W.H. S/Sgt. * LW Damuth, T.A. S/Sgt. TG Leinweber, R.L. S/Sgt. from www.b24.net/missions/MM031845.htm

comment.author: 74784995@N00
comment._content: Schwarzer and the rest of the crew of B-24 The Niagara Special had all successfully survived baling out over liberated French territory returning from a raid in January 1945 www.b24.net/stories/niagara.htm His name appears on the crew lists for the sight seeing 'Trolley Missions' over Germany immediately post war so perhaps 'shot down' refers to the bale-out incident over France...after which they flew more missions!
